Box 512 HlIsinki, FI-00023 Governme it FINLAND Administration Agrei'ment Ietween the Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland and the Internition dl Bank for Reconstruction and Development and the Interuationai De velol pment Association concerning the Multi-Donor Umbrella Facility for Ca acil Development (TF 071919) D.-ar Mr. Julin: 1. We are pleased to acknowledge on behalf of the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development ("IBRD") and the International Development Association ("IDA") (collectively, the "Bank") tha: th. Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland (the "Donor") shall make available as a grant 1he sum of two hundred thousand Euros (EUR 200,000) (the "Contribution") for the Multi Do ior I Umbrella Facility for Capacity Development (TF 071919) (-he "Trust Fund") i1 accor anc e w th the terms of this Agreement. Other donors are also expected to contributc to the 'rust Fui d on the terms and conditions specified in the Annexes to this Agreement. 2. The Contribution shIll be u! ed to finance activities to implement the World Bank Institute's (WBI) stralegy and elij,ible -xpenditures as set forth in the "Description of the Multi- Donor Umbrella Facility for Capacity Development" attached hereto as Annex 1, and shall be administered by the Bank on tiehlif of the Donor in accordance with the terms of this Agreement including the "Standard Provi. ion; Ap )licable to the Multi-Donor Umbrella Facility for Capacity Development" (the "Standard. P 'ovis ons") attached hereto as Annex 2, and "Other terms" at:ached hereto as Annex 3. 3. The Donor shall depo: it t ie Cintribution into such bank account designated by the Bank promptly following countersignature of this Agreement by the Donor and submission of a payment request by the Bank.

When making such d,!po;it, t ie Donor shall instruct its bank to include in its payment cetails information (remittar ce advi:e) field of its SWIFT payment message, information indicating: the amount paid, t tat Ihe p tyment is made by the Donor for TF 071919 (Multi-Donor Umbrella Facility fcr Capac ity De-%elopment), and the date of the deposit (the "Deposit Irstruction"). In addition, thc Donor hall provide a copy of the Donor's Deposit Instruction to the Bank's Accounting Trust Fur ds E ivision by e-mail sent to tfremitadvice@worldbank.org or by fax sent to (202) 614-1315 5. The Bank stall convert the Contribution funds into the holding currency of the Trust Fund, namely United States lollars, )romptly upon receipt of the Contribution funds and the Deposit Instruction containing the in formation specified in paragraph 4 at the exchange rate obtained by the Bank on th2 dite (f the conversion. Where the Contribution proves to be insufficient to complete the ac tivities s a result of an exchange rate fluctuation, neither the Bank nor the Donor shall bear any ri,sponsil: ility for providing any additional financing. 6. Except as provided fc r in para graph 4 above, any notice, request or other communication to be given or made under thi; Ayreer ient shall be in writing and delivered by mail, facsimile or e-mail to the respective part)'s .ddre3s specified below or at such other address as such party notifies in writing to Ihe other party friom time to time: For the Bank: Deena Philag Senior Partneiships O ficer Worl I Bank I istitute Worl d Bank (irou ip, N SN J 4-402 1818 H Streel NW WasHington, )C 20433-0002 Tel: (202) 47A-6'71 Fax: '202) 522-1679 E-mail: dphilage(wo -ldbank.org For the Donor: Matti Kiisseli Programme Cifficer Department f r Devel )pment Policy Mini:;try for Foreign iffairs of Finland Katajanokanl iitu-i 3 Helsinki FI-0 )02 3 Go iernment Finland Tel: +358 9 11505 516 1 Fax: +358 9 ]60' 632 3 Email: Matti. This Agreement may be amended only in wriling betv eer the 3ank and the Donor; provided, however, that such annexes may be amended only with th ag reerr ent of all donors contributing to the Trust Fund.

ï»¿-4- ANNEX I Description of the M ulti-Doi or Umbrella Facility for Capacity Development This Annex shall be e ppl cabl to and form an integral part of all agreements entered into between the Bank z.nd enti ies (col ectively, the "Donors") that provide contributions (the aggregate of all cont -ibution! from tl e Donors, the "Contributions") to be administered by the Bank for the Trust Fund. A. DESCRIPTION 1. The objective of the Fruit FL nd is to scale-up the reach and impact of the World Bank Institute's (WBI) strategy and its key areas which focus on capacity development and cut across WBl's clusters of services and busine s lines. 2. WBI's approach undt r its neN i strategy leverages World Bank's programs by catalyzing change for stronger developm teni rest Its through strengthening the capacity of government and non-government change agetits o cc Ilectively solve pressing development challenges. WBI's approach has been Etructure ] a:ount. three interlinked clusters that are aligned to the Open Development agenda for the World E ank: (a) Open Knowledge; (b) Collaborative Governance; and (c) Innovative Solutions. Under e ich cluster, WBI has developed new business lines, which include but are not limited to: (a) Open Knowledge pronmc tes c en, practical and accessible knowledge sharing through practitioner knowledge excha 1ge:;, e-larning and face-to-face courses. (i) Structured 1,ea -ninl,,. The e-Institute is the World Bank's virtual learning platform. Thi e-inst tute leverages innovative advances in information and comnunicatii n tOchn )logy to deliver high-quality and customized learning that can be accesscd by de velopment stakeholders. (ii) Knowledge Lxchang ,. WBI provides support to client countries and the World Bank's operz tior.s te: ms with the tools that facilitate peer-to-peer knowledge exchanges anong dev ,loping countries. (b) Collaborative Governance promotes collaborative leadership and multi-stakeholder action for more inclusive and sus aina >le development results. (i) Government Transr arency and Geo-mapping. WBI maps government data, including so(ial infr;Lstructures, government's budgets, and IFC, MIGA and World Bank proj -ct I cations. (ii) Non-Govern nental Wetors' Capacity. WBI works with diverse stakeholders such as govei nm nts, civil society, media, the private sector, and parliaments to strengthen puDlic acc< untability to help citizens receive better services. (iii) Citizen Engigeiment through ICT. WBI works with a variety of development stakeholders to pron ote mechanisms that connect citizens to public service providers anc policy nakers, and that provide feedback on the quality of public servi,es and I he effec iveness of donor-funded programs.
ï»¿-5- (iv) Mulli-Stakel i.d er Governance. WBI facilitates collaboration among stakeholders and neti vorks by designing and delivering a structured multiyear capacity-buildinE proi ess that fosters a commitment to collective innovation and collaDorative action f r positive change. (e) Innovative S olution. ad vanc,s new development solutions through innovation platforms or competitions. (i) Competitions and Challenges. WBI leverages the global reach of new and innovative s lut ons to key development challenges using technologies, tools, methods and Dnl ne p atforms. (ii) WB[ Innov.tio a U b. WBI scales-up innovations across the Bank including identifying ;utt ng-e ige innovations, developing an "innovation portfolio" aligned with World F ank strategic priorities. B. ELIGIBLE EXPEl, DYVUR iS The Contributions may be usd to finance expenditures that are eligible under the Bank's applicable policies, procedur s, and u nder the Administrative Manual.
ï»¿-6- ANNEX 2 Standarc Provisions Applicable to the Multi-Don,)r Umb, ella Facility for Capacity Development This Annex shall be ipplicabl to and form an integral part of all agreements entered into between the Bank and the Dc nor s the t provide Contributions to be administered by the Bank for the Trust Fund. I. Administration of the Ccntrib itions 1.1. The Bank shall be re sponsibi - only for performing those functions specifically set forth in this Agreement and shall lot be si ibject to any other duties or responsibilities to the Donors, including, without li nitation an ' dul ies or obligations that might otherwise apply to a fiduciary or trustee under general prin :ipl -s of trust or fiduciary law. Nothing in this Agreement shall be considered a waiver of any privi eges or immunities of the IBRD and IDA under their Articles of Agreement or any applicable lax, all )f which are expressly reserved. .2. The Contribution sh 11 be adhninistered in accordance with the Bank's applicable policies and procedures, as :he samo may b- amended from time to time, including its framework to prevent and combat fraud anJ1 cc rrup ion and its screening procedures to prevent the use of Bank resources to finance terroris: activit:', in line with the Bank's obligations to give effect to the relevant decisions of the Sc:cur.ty C ouncil, taken under Chapter VII of the of Charter of the United Nations. The Donor acknow edges that this provision does not create any obligations of the Bank under th. anti-ttrro-ist inancing and asset control laws, regulations, rules and executive orders of an indi [duil m mber country that may apply to the Donor, nor shall it be deemed a waiver, express or imr lied, of any of the privileges and immunities of the Bank. 2. Commingling. Exch ngc and Investment of the Contributions 2.1. The Contributions sl all be at counted for as a single trust fund and shall be kept separate and apart from the -unds of the Bar k. The Contributions may be commingled with other trust fund assets maintained by th Bank. 2.2. The Contributions r iay be f -eely exchanged by the Bank into other currencies as may facilitate their disbursement. 2.3. The Bank shall inN est and reinvest the Contributions pending their disbursement in accordance with the BanL's polil:ies and procedures for the investment of trust funds administered by the Bank. The Bar k shall credit all income from such investment to the Trust Fund to be used for the sam! pupost s as the Contributions. 3. Administrative Cost Recovei y In order to assist ir th: del rayment of the costs of administration and other expenses incurred by the Bank under this Agr -ement, the Bank may deduct and retain for its own account an amount equal to five per eni (50/) of each Contribution. If the contributions increase beyond what was original y expected at ;he time of counter-signature of the first administration agreement, and the admini: tralive ( osts increase as a result, the Donors acknowledge that an additional administrative fec m,.y be applied to such new contributions.
ï»¿-7- 4 Grants to Recigents 4 1. The Bank shall, as admi iistr, tor of the Trust Fund on behalf of the Donors, enter into grant agreements (the "Grant Agieem< nts") with one or more entities acceptable to the Bank (the "Recipients") consist -nt with the purp oses of this Agreement and on the terms and conditions set forth in the Grant Agreemerits. Grznt Agreements may be entered into up to the maximum anount of the Cortributious that all Donors have agreed to make available under the Administration Agreements ietween ;he Bank and the Donors. Upon request by a Donor, the Bank shall furnish a copy of te Grant Agreements to the Donors. 4.2. The Bank shall be r!spc nsib e for the supervision of the activities financed under the Grant Agreements. Subject to the ( onsent of the relevant Recipients, representatives of the Jonors may be invited by tfie E ank to participate in Bank supervision missions related to the Trust Fund. 4.3. The Bank shall prom ptly infc rm the Donors of any significant modification to the terms of any Grant Agreements an; I of any contractual remedies that are exercised by the Bank under any Grant Agreements. To the e, tent practicable, the Bank shall afford the Donors the opportunity to exchange views )efoi. effecting any such modification or exercising any such remedy. 5. Procurement 5.1. For Recipient-exectted act vities, the Grant Agreements shall provide that the Contributions shall be used tiy the R< cipients to finance expenditures for goods and services, as t-e case may be, in accordance with he Bank's Guidelines on "Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits" and the Baink's Gu idelines on the "Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers', as ir effect at the date of entry into the respective Grant Agreements. 5.2. For Bank-executed ac,tivities, the employment and supervision of any consultants and the procurement of any goods fiian zed I y the Contributions shall be the responsibility of the Bank and shall be carried out in ac orc ance with its applicable policies and procedures. 6. Accounting and Finaicial Re 1orting 6.1. The Bank :hall maLinttin !eparate records and ledger accounts in respect of the Contributions deposited in t T -ust I'und account and disbursements made therefrom. 6.2. The Bank shall furnish to the Donors current financial information relating to receipts, disbursements and fund bahincc in ie holding currency of the Trust Fund with respect to the Contributions via the World Bank's Trust Funds Donor Center secure website. Within six (6) months after all corrimitmer ts and I abilities under the Trust Fund have been satisfied and the Trust Fund has bee,i closed, th. finil financial information relating to receipts, disbursements and fund balance in the hold ng 2urr ncy of the Trust Fund with respect to the Contributions will )e made available tc the Doriors via t ie World Bank's Trust Funds Donor Center secure website.
ï»¿-8- 6.3. The Bank shall provide io th< Donors, within six (6) months following the end of each Bank fiscal year, an annual s ng]e au lit report, comprising (1) a management assertion together with an attestation from the Fani's e> ternal auditors concerning the adequacy of internal control over cash-based financial rep:)rti:g for all cash-based trust funds as a whole; and (2) a combined Fnancial statement for all cish-basel trust funds together with the Bank's external auditor's opinion thereon. The cost of :he singli audit shall be borne by the Bank. 6.4. If a Donor w ishes to request, on an exceptional basis, a financial statement audit by the Bank's external aud[tors of the Tru t Fund, the Donor and the Bank shall first consult as to whether such an external aidit is i,ecessary. The Bank and the Donor shall agree on the appropriate scope and terms of iefer nce of such audit. Following agreement on the scope and terms of reference, tie Bank sh 11 ar ange for such external audit. The costs of any such audit, including the internal costs o tho Bai,k with respect to such audit, shall be paid by the requesting Donor. 6.5. The Bank shall prov de the Donors with copies of all financial statements and auditors' ieports received by tie Bank froi n th( Recipients pursuant to the Grant Agreements. 7. Progress Reporting . 1. The Bank shall pr )vice tl e Donors with an annual report on the results of the implementation of WBI's tralegy. Within six (6) months of the final disbursement date specified in paragraph 8.1, the Fank hall furnish to the Donors a final report on the results of the mplementation of WBI's strategy 7.2 Any Donor may rev ew or e-aluate the Trust Fund. The Donor and the Bank shall agree on the scope and conduct o su:h re view or evaluation, and the Bank shall provide all relevant information within 1 he limit; of its I olicies and procedures. All associated costs shall be borne by the Donor. It is understc od :hat ny such review or evaluation will not constitute a financial, compliance or other audit of the Trus t Fund. 8. Disbursement;Caellation' Refund 8.1 It is expected that 1 he Cont ibutions will be fully disbursed by the Bank by April 30, 2018. The Bank shall only disburse Contributions for the purposes of this Agreement after such date with the written approval of the Donors. 8.2 Any Donor or the Batc ma , upon three (3) months' prior written notice, cancel all or part of the Donor's pro rata share, o 'any remaining balance of the Contributions net of expenses that have been charged to the T -ust Fund prior to the receipt of such notice. 8.3. Following :he final disbursiment date specified in paragraph 8.1, the Bank shall return any remaining balance of the Con ributions to the Donors or to the relevant Donor Balance Account on a pro rata basis base I on the Donors' paid Contributions. In the event of a cancellation the Bank shall prompt y return to the relevant Donor or Donors or to the relevant Donor Balance Account the Donor'! pro rata share in accordance with paragraph 8.2.
ï»¿-9- 9 Disclosure The Bank will disclc se his Agreement and related information on this Trust Fund in accordance with the World Bank I olicy on Access to Information. By entering into this Agreement, Donors consent to di:;clos ire of this Agreement and related information on this Trust Fund.
ï»¿-10- ANNEX 3 Other Terms The following goverrance terns shall apply to the Multi-Donor Umbrella Facility for Capacity Development: I. The Donors agree th, t tl e Bank has responsibility for Trust Fund operations under the terms of this Administration Agieem,nt, including with respect to the allocation of funds, the implementation of Bank-execatec activities and the supervision of Recipient-executed activities. F3r clarity, decisions on work prc gran s and allocation of funds will be made by the Bank. 2. The Bank agrees to c on ene innual meetings to which all Donors are invited ("Annual Consultations"). The purpoe oL the Annual Consultations is for the Bank and the Donors to discuss: (a) Results (as d fin ,d bc low) presented by the Bank; (b) future progran plans )resented by the Bank; (c) broad strategc giidai ce reflective of(a) and (b). 3. "Results" will be reportcd by the Bank and reviewed at the Annual Consultations on the basis of the results frameworl fo- W1 I's strategy, as may be modified over time. Progress reporting w 11 occur zn a unified, common basis for all Donors.
